definition: to turn big problems into small ones, and small problems into no problems at all (idiom)
pinyin: da4 shi4 hua4 xiao3 , xiao3 shi4 hua4 liao3

sentences.english: Even bides such as a quarrel between husband and wife are brought to the peasant association.
sentences.chinese: 連兩公婆吵架的小事，也要到農民協會去解決。

sentences.english: The great arises out of small things that are honored and cared for.
sentences.chinese: 事無鉅細，任何大事都是由一系列的小事組成的。

sentences.english: As it happens it's been a very profitable non-event.
sentences.chinese: 沒想到這件事情成了件很賺錢的小事兒。

sentences.english: Life is long because of all the small things. The slow pace.
sentences.chinese: 有了這些小事兒，生命才顯得長久。

sentences.english: Turning your lights off for an hour this Saturday from 8.30pm is a small, simple act that is easy to publicise.
sentences.chinese: 30關燈一小時是一件簡單易行，容易推廣的小事。

sentences.english: When that day comes to you, the broke up that you have been through just was a piece of cake.
sentences.chinese: 當那一天到來，你所經歷的分手只不過是小事一樁。

sentences.english: But consistent lying -- even about minor matters -- can unglue a marriage.
sentences.chinese: 但是一些小事上惹出的連篇謊話都能導致婚姻擱淺。

sentences.english: I don't think it's neccessary for you to sue him for such a matter.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲就這點小事，沒必要對他提起訴訟。

sentences.english: It really is of no matter, but I fail to see why you should get so warm over a trifle.
sentences.chinese: 這只不過是個小事，但我不明白你爲何如此大動肝火。

sentences.english: There are a lot of simple little things that can make you much happier.
sentences.chinese: 有很多小事兒能使你快樂起來。

sentences.english: No problem. No task is too small for the Waterboy.
sentences.chinese: 沒問題，對茶水小子來說沒有什麼是小事。

sentences.english: But consistent lying — even about minor matters — can unglue a marriage.
sentences.chinese: 但是一些小事上惹出的連篇謊話都能導致婚姻擱淺。

sentences.english: They are locked together in a fierce quarrel over a trivial matter.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲了一點小事而吵得難分難解。

sentences.english: While it's true that the big things matter, the little things do too.
sentences.chinese: 大事兒要緊這沒錯，但小事兒同樣的。

sentences.english: At length a trifle snapped our connection;
sentences.chinese: 終於因爲一件小事，把我們的關係弄僵了。

sentences.english: His main weakness is to quibble over unimportant things.
sentences.chinese: 他的主要缺點是愛對小事吹毛求疵。

definition: lit. chicken feathers and garlic skins (idiom)/fig. trivial (matter)
major event/major political event (war or change of regime)/major social event (wedding or funeral)/(do sth) in a big way/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1]
one's employment/business/matter that needs to be settled/(northern dialect) (of a person) demanding/trying/troublesome/erhua variant of 事[shi4]/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1]
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
lit. the exertion of lifting one's hand (idiom)/fig. a very slight effort
to make a big fuss over a minor issue (idiom)
to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
good action, deed, thing or work (also sarcastic, "a fine thing indeed")/charity/happy occasion/Daoist or Buddhist ceremony for the souls of the dead
